general: This law makes sure that people who work in the UK pay money towards their healthcare and pensions when they are older. It also helps people who are too sick or having a baby by giving them some money to support themselves while they are not working. The government uses this money to help provide these benefits to those who need them.

series.text:

* Overpayments received by employers due to regulations under section 167 of the Contributions and Benefits Act are also subject to penalties up to £3,000.
* Schedule 1 to the Employment Act 2002 (penalties relating to statutory paternity pay and statutory adoption pay: procedures and appeals) applies in relation to penalties imposed under this section with specified modifications.

summary: The National Insurance Contributions and Statutory Payments Act 2004 simplifies the process for employers to recover unpaid National Insurance contributions through distraint of goods and chattels. It also grants revenue assessment powers to officers of the Inland Revenue to call for documents related to Class 1, 1A, 1B, or 2 contributions. Additionally, the law creates a compliance regime for statutory sick pay and statutory maternity pay in Great Britain, allowing for penalties for non-compliance and fraudulent or negligent behavior. Finally, the law makes minor changes to existing laws related to national insurance contributions and statutory payments, effective on various dates, and includes a schedule of repeals and revocations of previous laws and instruments.
